cyclone.name: IAN
cyclone.current_location: about 345 mi SSE of Grand Cayman
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to turn northwest today, then north-northwest Monday and north Tuesday, crossing western Cuba Monday night/early Tuesday and then moving into the eastern Gulf of Mexico toward the Florida peninsula and the southeast United States coast later in the week.

weather_observation.watch_coast: None in effect for U.S. coastline at this time
weather_observation.warning_coast: None in effect for U.S. coastline at this time
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Western Cuba Monday night/Tuesday, Florida Keys and Florida peninsula mid-week, then portions of the southeast U.S. coast (including Georgia and South Carolina) late week
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Possible but uncertain (depends on eventual inland track toward Georgia late week)
weather_observation.wind: Low (17%) chance of tropical-storm-force winds reaching the port late Thursday into Friday; higher gusts possible if the forecast track shifts eastward.
weather_observation.storm_surge: At this stage no NHC storm-surge forecast has been issued for the Georgia coast.
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rain-bands late week could bring periods of heavy rain and localized flooding, especially if Ian tracks inland over or just west of eastern Georgia.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough seas, dangerous rip currents, and possible schedule disruptions to inbound/outbound vessels late week.
